metadata.synopsis:
However this scene plays out, the warlock is enigmatic and self-assured - she saves players and then departs, hinting toward the help that her master can offer in other similar situations.Players have been captured by the goblin priestess and could not escape their chains. After they rest, the priestess returns to see if they've transformed into mind flayers (as she expected) and is disappointed to see they haven't. She intends to kill them, but a warlock intervenes and saves the players, killing the priestess.

The warlock has been sent by its master, a cambion called The Monitor, who players may have met already.

15.speaker: True Soul Gut
15.text: Open your peepers, freak. It's time.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: player waking up - blinking, seeing priestess standing right before them, leaning in closeNodeContext: speaking to player who is captive, in chains - they've been resting and she's waking them

47.speaker: True Soul Gut
47.text: You should be sprouting tentacles by now, but you're still the same kind of ugly you always was.

10.speaker: True Soul Gut
10.text: Disappointing not to have my own squiddie... but your giblets'll make for a tasty supper.

12.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~A portal opens behind the priestess, and the warlock steps through and slits the priestess' throat. As the priestesses throat is slit, her blood sprays all over the player

24.speaker: Korrilla
24.text: Sorry - I may have left that a little late. No lasting damage, I hope?
24.context: NodeContext: brushing herself down after killing a goblin priestess - apologetic, amused. speaking to a chained player she just rescued

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I'm still breathing, at least. Thank you.

61.speaker: Korrilla
61.text: It's my master you should thank. When you got yourself into this predicament, he sent me to help.

4.speaker: Korrilla
4.text: You'll meet him soon, and have a chance to show your gratitude.

44.context: CinematicNodeContext: The warlock opens the chains with magic - a simple gesture like a finger click rather than complicated casting is good

37.speaker: Korrilla
37.text: You'll meet him again soon, and have a chance to show your gratitude.

34.speaker: Korrilla
34.text: You made quite an impression on my master - he sends his regards.

22.speaker: Korrilla
22.text: My master has been keeping a close eye on you. When you got yourself into this predicament, he sent me to help.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Could you get me out of these chains?

32.speaker: Korrilla
32.text: And before you thank me - save your breath.

29.speaker: Korrilla
29.text: You'll meet my master soon, and have a chance to show your gratitude.

3.speaker: Korrilla
3.text: In the meantime, try not to get yourself killed. I won't always be watching.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~She vanishes back into her portal with a cheeky waveNodeContext: slightly mocking, but good-natured

43.speaker: Korrilla
43.text: You'll meet my master again soon, and have a chance to show your gratitude.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Your master? Who might that be?

46.speaker: Korrilla
46.text: The honourable Raphael. He's terribly excited about you... and your condition.
46.context: NodeContext: trying to entice us, tickling our curiosity

1.speaker: Korrilla
1.text: An observer. He's curious about you... and your condition.
1.context: NodeContext: trying to entice us, tickling our curiosity

28.speaker: Korrilla
28.text: At this point, you're more interesting alive than dead. So here I am, your saviour in times of need.

19.speaker: Korrilla
19.text: Be a little more careful. That skin's valuable, and we won't always be watching.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~[dupe] She vanishes back into her portal with a cheeky wave

39.speaker: Korrilla
39.text: At this point, you're more interesting alive than dead. So here I am, your saviour in times of need.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: A warlock? Pass your master a message: shove off.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Raphael's warlock? Pass him a message: shove off.

25.speaker: Korrilla
25.text: That's hardly how you should speak of your saviour.
25.context: NodeContext: scolding but with a smile

54.speaker: Korrilla
54.text: Besides - you can convey your message in person. You'll meet him soon enough.

5.speaker: Korrilla
5.text: Besides - you can convey your message in person. You'll meet him again soon enough.

45.speaker: Korrilla
45.text: No lasting damage, I hope? You're Zariel's little pet, if I'm not mistaken.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Not anymore. If you're here to take me back, I'll kill you.

35.speaker: Korrilla
35.text: Kill me? I don't think so. You can't even wriggle out of those chains.

9.speaker: Korrilla
9.text: Oh, please. There's not a devil in the Hells that doesn't know Zariel's favourite has become a fugitive.

23.speaker: Korrilla
23.text: I must say, seeing the infamous Demonsbane at the mercy of a goblin is very disappointing.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Does your kind master have a name?

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Get an eyeful. It won't happen again.

60.speaker: Korrilla
60.text: Don't worry. My master sent me to help.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Believe me, the goblin's the least of my worries.

31.speaker: Korrilla
31.text: I know all about your situation... your condition. My master has taken a personal interest.

16.speaker: Korrilla
16.text: You already met him - the honourable Raphael. He's terribly excited about you... and your condition.

6.speaker: Korrilla
6.text: You haven't met him yet. But you will. Soon.
